Package controller

Class MainScreen

  • java.lang.Object
    • controller.MainScreen
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.fxml.Initializable
    public class MainScreen
extends java.lang.Object
implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
    This class controls the application window for the MainScreen screen.

        public void initialize​(java.net.URL url,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
        The initialize method sets up the MainScreen screen on launch.

      • onPartAddButton

        public void onPartAddButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        The onPartAddButton launches the AddPart screen. This method sets the stage and scene for the AddPart screen and loads the application window.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the MainScreen screen RUNTIME ERROR: The add button threw a runtime error load exception, Null pointer exception when clicked. The initialize method in the AddPart class contained code for changing a label that did not exist. This label was created during the early process of creating the program and was later deleted. The error was corrected by removing the invalid code for changing the label.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onPartModifyButton

        public void onPartModifyButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        The onPartModifyButton method launches the ModifyPart screen. This method sets the stage and scene for the ModifyPart screen and loads the application window. It also sets the partToModify for the ModifyPart screen.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the MainScreen screen
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onPartDeleteButton

        public void onPartDeleteButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onPartDeleteButton is called when the user clicks the delete button on the MainScreen screen. This method confirms the user wants to delete the selected part and then removes is from the allParts list in Inventory.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the MainScreen screen

      • onProductAddButton

        public void onProductAddButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        The onProductAddButton method launches the AddProduct screen. This method sets the stage and scene for the AddProduct screen and loads the application window.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the MainScreen screen
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onProductModifyButton

        public void onProductModifyButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
                           throws java.io.IOException
        The onPartModifyButton method launches the ModifyProduct screen. This method sets the stage and scene for the ModifyProduct screen and loads the application window. It also sets the productToModify for the ModifyProduct screen.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the MainScreen screen
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • onProductDeleteButton

        public void onProductDeleteButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onProductDeleteButton is called when the user clicks the delete button on the MainScreen screen. This method confirms the user wants to delete the selected product and then removes is from the allProducts list in Inventory.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the MainScreen screen

      • onExitButton

        public void onExitButton​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onExitButton is called when the user clicks the exit button on the MainScreen screen. This method confirms the user would like to quit and then closes the application.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the button click on the MainScreen screen

      • onSearchParts

        public void onSearchParts​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onSearchParts is called when the user presses enter while the cursor is in the search window on the MainScreen screen. This method calls the lookupPart method from Inventory and searches for the part based on the user input. Then it places the parts in the tableview.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the enter press on the user keyboard

      • onSearchProducts

        public void onSearchProducts​(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
        The onSearchProducts is called when the user presses enter while the cursor is in the search window on the MainScreen screen. This method calls the lookupProduct method from Inventory and searches for the product based on the user input. Then it places the products in the tableview.
        Parameters:
        actionEvent - the enter press on the user keyboard
